intro: Ruellia viscidula, commonly known as sticky ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its glandular, sticky leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, attracting various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Ruellia viscidula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
